## closest() function

Returns the first ancestor of `element` that matches the selector(s), or, optionally, itself.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function closest<T extends Element>(element: Element, selectors: string, skipSelf?: boolean): null | T;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

</td><td>

Element


</td><td>

The element from which to search.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

selectors


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

One or more selectors to match.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

skipSelf


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Ignore `element` even if it matches.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

null \| T
